Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) test unit was constructed with YSZ electrolyte as the support, and with Ni-YSZ anode (Ni: YSZ = 3:5 in weight) and Pt cathode.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: Direct methane SOFC operation at 800 degrees C with 10% CH4 in argon was carried out.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: A new phenomenon of the generation of the electrical current without the fuel was observed and termed the fuel-free current.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: An operation of intermittent methane supply was designed to take advantage of three driving forces, i.e. methane in the gas phase, the deposited carbon at the anode surface, and a deficiency of the bulk lattice-oxygen concentration on the anode side, for the generation of the electrical current.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: A continuous generation of the electrical current is obtained with a methane pulse of only one-fifth of the total operation time.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: The operation of intermittent methane flow can reduce or even avoid SOFC deactivation by the carbon deposition; at the same time, the deposited carbon can be fully utilized for the power generation.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs

Sentencas: It was also found that hydrogen from methane has been mostly evolved to the outlet gaseous product and the amount of CO formation is much higher than that of CO2; the operation of intermittent methane flow can further increase the amount of CO over that of CO2; these are beneficial for the co-generation of synthesis gas.
Titulo: A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs
A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs
A new phenomenon of a fuel-free current during intermittent fuel flow over Ni-YSZ anode in direct methane SOFCs
